elements.description:
This is the name of the person 'making the Protection Order application'. If you are helping someone use this app and they are the ones who will be making the application themselves, use their name. If you are making this application on behalf of another person, use your name.

Use the name as it is written on your primary ID cards. This name will be the most useful.

You do not have a lawyer that has agreed to receive court documents for you.

After you get your lawyer, they may help you change the address for receiving court documents to their address.

elements.name: FAQLawyer2
elements.title: What if I used to have a lawyer but not anymore?
elements.body:
You do not have a lawyer that has agreed to receive court documents for you.

You will need to give an address where it is safe for you to receive court documents.

If you already have a Provincial Court Family Law file and you don't have a lawyer anymore, you may need to update your address for service.

Click here to download the form. (This link will open in a new tab.)

elements.name: ExplanationServiceAddress
elements.title:
You need to give an address where it is safe for you to receive court documents. The person protection is needed from will see this address on your court documents.

You do not have to use your home address or the address of where you are staying right now. You can pick an address where you can receive court documents such as your workplace, a family member's home or a friend's home.

elements.title: Please add the details of the other party in the fields below. If you need to add another party, click the 'Add Other Party' button. If you are done entering all the parties, click the 'Next' button.
elements.description:
Who do I name as the other party?
  • If your application is about a child, the other party must include each of their parents and guardians
  • If your application is about spousal support, the other party is your spouse
  • If another adult is the subject of your application, such as a step-parent, grandparent or other important person in a child's life, this person is the other party
  • If there is already an existing case, you cannot add more parties, the other party is the person or persons that are already involved in that case

elements.name: marriageStartDateFAQ
elements.title: How do I determine the start date?
elements.body:
Under the law, the start date of a spousal relationship is the day two individuals begin living together in a marriage-like relationship, or the day they were married, whichever is first. The start date of a spousal relationship determines when rights or responsibilities start under the Family Law Act, particularly respecting property division.

What do I do if I can't remember the exact date? If you cannot remember the exact date then enter:
  • the last day of that month in which you decided to live in a marriage like relationship, and;
  • year

templateElements.title: Please provide the following contact information for {panel.OtherPartyName}.
templateElements.description:
What if I don't have contact information for the other party?

If you don't have contact information, you can leave any part of this section blank. Provide as much information as you do have.

You will still be required to arrange for service of court documents on the other party but you don't always need a physical address to do that. You might know a place where the person goes regularly like a gym or a coffee shop.

You also have options to apply to the court for an order allowing you to serve the other party in another way or the court registry can work with you to make a search request for information about where the other party may be located.

elements.name: doYouWantToApply
elements.title: Do you want to apply for a court order about any of the following?
elements.description:
Parenting arrangements how each guardian will parent their child(ren), including each guardians' parenting responsibilities for decision making about a child and the parenting time each guardian spends with a child. Parenting responsibilities may be shared or exercised separately. The only thing you can consider in making your parenting arrangements is what is in the best interest of the child.

Child support is the amount of money a parent or guardian pays to another parent or guardian to help care for the child(ren). A child has the right to be supported by both parents, whether or not the parents ever lived together or the parent has ever lived with the child.

Contact with a child time a child spends with someone who is not their guardian. This person could include a parent who is not a guardian to a child, or other people, like grandparents.

Guardianship who is responsible for a child. Only guardians have parental responsibilities and parenting time with a child. An agreement or order about parenting arrangements can say a child's guardians share parental responsibilities or parenting time, or it can say one guardian is responsible for more of the parenting decisions and has more of the parenting time with the child.

Spousal support money that one spouse pays to another spouse for their financial support after separation. A person is not entitled to spousal support in every case.

elements.name: ParentingResponsibilitiesInfo
elements.title:
Parenting Responsibilities

Guardians make decisions about their child, including daily care and supervision, education, medical treatment, receiving information about the child from others, and protecting the child's legal and financial interests. These are parental responsibilities. Guardians share parental responsibilities unless they have a court order or agreement that says otherwise. The Family Law Act provides a list of parental responsibilities.

elements.name: applyingForParentalResponsibilities
elements.title: Are you applying for an order that gives you all parental responsibilities for child(ren)?
elements.description: If you are the only guardian for a child, you may need a court order to prove that you are the only person who makes decisions for the child including things like permission to travel and consent for medical procedures.

elements.name: childrenForParentingArrng
elements.title: Select the name of each child you are requesting all parental responsibilities for

elements.name: describeHowToExerciseParentalRes
elements.title: Describe how you want the parental responsibilities to be exercised by the guardians
elements.description:
If there is more than one guardian for a child, an agreement or court order can help to make it clear who can make which parenting decisions and when. Parenting decisions may be made together, by only one guardian, or divided between more than one guardian. You must carefully consider which way is best for the child.

You do not need to use any special wording. The key is to be clear about what you mean and what you are asking the court to order.

elements.name: ParentingTimeInfo
elements.title:
Parenting time

Parenting time is the time each guardian spends with the child. Guardians can arrange parenting time in any way that is in the best interests of the child. Parenting time can be shared equally, or one guardian can have the child more of the time.

elements.name: needOrderForTimeAlloc
elements.title: Do you need an order for the allocation of parenting time?
elements.description: During parenting time, a guardian has the parental responsibility of making day-to-day decisions affecting the child and having day-to-day care, control, and supervision of the child.

pages.name: Parenting Time

elements.name: explainArrangementSection
elements.title: Parenting time is the time each guardian spends with the child.  Guardians can arrange parenting time in any way that is in the best interests of the child.  Parenting time can be shared equally, or one guardian can have the child more of the time.

elements.name: explainParentingTime
elements.title:
I am applying for Parenting Time to be allocated as follows:

The following questions will help to explain to the court and the other party how you want parenting time with the child(ren) to look.

elements.name: describeHowTimeSpent
elements.title: Describe how and when you want the children to spend time with you
elements.description:
You can give as much detail as you would like to ask the court to include in the order. You know your family. If you think lots of detail is needed, make sure you make that clear here.

Consider when a child should spend time with you, including special days like birthdays, holidays or cultural occasions, what drop offs and pick ups should look like, and any other important details you think should be included in the court order.

elements.name: isConditionPlaced
elements.title: Are you willing to have any conditions placed on the time you will spend with your children?
elements.description: Consider if you should have any conditions on your parenting time. Conditions may include things like where the parenting time will take place or who else should or should not be around during parenting time. You may want to be specific about parenting time including bringing the child to activities, time with friends or important cultural experiences. Sometimes having conditions on the parenting time will make everyone feel more comfortable that the best interests of a child are being considered.

elements.name: whatConditions
elements.title: Describe any conditions you are willing to have placed on your time with the child(ren).
elements.description: You do not need to use any special wording.  The key is to be clear about what you mean and what you are asking the court to order.

elements.name: describeHowChildSpendTime
elements.title: Describe how and when you want the children to spend time with the other party.
elements.description:
You can give as much detail as you would like to ask the court to include in the order. You know your family. If you think lots of detail is needed, make sure you make that clear here.

Consider how you think your child should spend time with the other guardian, including special days like birthdays, holidays or cultural occasions, what drop offs and pick ups should look like, and any other important details you think should be included in the court order.

elements.name: anyOtherGuardianCondition
elements.title: Do you want any conditions placed on the time the other guardian(s) will spend with the children?
elements.description: Consider you want the other party to have conditions on their parenting time.  Conditions may include things like where the parenting time will take place or who else should or should not be around during parenting time. You may want to be specific about parenting time including bringing the child to activities, time with friends or important cultural experiences.

elements.name: BestIntInfo
elements.title:
When you make parenting arrangements, you must consider what is in the best interests of your child(ren). Every family situation is unique and the court needs to know why you believe the order you are asking for is best for your child(ren).

To determine what is in the child's best interests when making parenting arrangements, you must consider factors including:
  • The child's emotional health and well-being
  • The child's views, unless it would be inappropriate to consider them
  • The child's relationships with parents, guardians, and other important people
  • The history of care, and
  • The impact of any family violence

elements.name: explainChildSupportCalc
elements.title:
Child support is the amount of money a parent or guardian pays to another parent or guardian to help care for the child(ren). A child has the right to be supported by both parents, whether or not the parents ever lived together or the parent has ever lived with the child.

Usually the court orders an amount of child support based on the Federal Child Support Guidelines. This amount is called the guideline table amount and is meant to cover regular expenses like clothes, food and housing.

The court can order an amount other than the guideline table amount in certain situations, such as:
  • When a child is 19 or older
  • When the parent paying support has an income over $150,000
  • When parents split or share parenting time
  • When there is undue hardship

To calculate how much child support should be paid, you can visit the Department of Justice website on child support which includes detailed information including the Federal Child Support Guidelines Step-by-Step and a Child Support Table Look-up.
You can also talk with a Child Support Officer at the Justice Access Centre or talk to a lawyer. For more information about child support and referrals to other child support resources, visit the BC Government website at www.gov.bc.ca.

elements.name: undueHardshipFactSheet
elements.title: Are you or your spouse claiming undue hardship?
elements.description: If you our your spouse feel that the child support amount will not leave enough money, you can claim that you will suffer undue hardship.

elements.name: factSheetPanel
factSheetFAQ
elements.title: Since you have previously indicated that you will be claiming undue hardship you will need to provide answers to the next set of questions. A claim for undue hardship can only be considered if the parent making the claim can show that their household’s standard of living is not higher than the standard of living in the household of the other parent. Often, income alone (which is all that is used to calculate the guideline amount) does not reflect other circumstances that may impact a households’ finances.

elements.name: debtsFactSheet
elements.title: Unusual or excessive debts
elements.description: What are the unusual or excessive debts that you owe? These are debts that were taken on to support the family before you separated (e.g. student loans). The debt can also be due to earning a living (e.g. vehicle, specialized equipment).

columns.name: What are the terms of this debt ?
